The unicorn on the British coat of arms does indeed represent Scotland The unicorn is one of the two supporters on the coat of arms of the United Kingdom, with the other being a lion representing England The unicorn has been associated with Scotland since the 12th century, and it is featured on the Scottish coat of arms The use of the unicorn on the British coat of arms reflects the unity of the two countries under a single monarch
